intro: Pseudacanthopale, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its thick, succulent stems that store water. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers, and its leaves are typically alternate and simple. Pseudacanthopale is known for its latex sap, which can be toxic and is used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
